page.title: 16Home Life in Knockholt
page.content: Locally or homegrown produce and eggs enable people to batch-bake and prepare food and vegetables for quick and wholesome meals using freezing and other methods of preserving. Wine and beer are made using hedgerow fruits or kits. As a result of foreign travel dishes fron other countries are cooked or brought home ready prepared. The main meal is usually in the evening. Barbecues are popular. Microwave ovens are time saving.Telephones,central heating and double glazing are common as are washing machines. Many homes have television, videos and music centres for leisure interest and instruction. Some homes have burglar alarms and "Neighbourhood Watch" schemes help keep homes secure. Some horses and ponies are owned but dogs, cats and fish in ponds are more usual pets. Ponds attract frogs and insects.
